data.text:
@1alabaster @AmandaKvalsvig @Dr_Jenn_Summers @Carmen24717883 @CervanteeWild @CDDJ15 Hi @1alabaster! There's no real advice on preventing #LongCovidKids. Rest assured that most kids will bounce back no problem - so it's more about having awareness of the potential symptoms that may indicate recovery is ongoing/delayed.

@LongCovidKids have some great resources https://t.co/MtX67mwjrF

@AmandaKvalsvig @DrAnnaNZ @Dr_Jenn_Summers @Carmen24717883 @CervanteeWild @CDDJ15 Thanks for this enlightening information. My 8 & 10 year olds currently have covid (Auckland). What is the advice to prevent long covid? I can’t see any from MoH. Thanks in advance.
@AmandaKvalsvig @OtagoWellington @Jenene Amen. We have thrown our children to the Covid wolf. The information is building that this is not a (mild) respiratory virus at all.
@astropodian @AmandaKvalsvig @OtagoWellington @Jenene Maybe we are at the crowd funding public health messages stage of the pandemic. Happy to chip in.
@AmandaKvalsvig @OtagoWellington @Jenene Though I do respect the fine line public health has to tread between inspiring action while not instilling too much fear...

@AmandaKvalsvig @OtagoWellington @Jenene How might we translate this into something that could be in the form of a widely distributed public health poster? Something resonant that notes, say, that polio is usually mild, and that what we think of as polio is actually "long polio"...

@AmandaKvalsvig @OtagoWellington @Jenene I’m seeing a lot of anecdotal reports from paediatricians and people who run PANS/PANDAS groups overseas that post-acute Covid kids are getting PANS. Have you got any more information on this?

@AmandaKvalsvig @ConversationEDU It would be great if kids could at least be fully vaccinated and get special accommodations if they cannot be vaccinated or are otherwise vulnerable or have vulnerable family members. Of course they might still need to go to school or childcare if no one can stay home with them.

@AmandaKvalsvig @ConversationEDU But they should also bring back the policy that people need to work from home wherever possible. There needs to be a right to home office. It’s crazy that some businesses have everyone in attendance in their large shared offices, are mixing, mingling & travelling as if it’s 2019.

@AmandaKvalsvig @ConversationEDU The older kids take off their masks outside or if they need a ‘mask break’. Know about so many now that brought Covid home from school. Misleading ‘propaganda’ about it rarely spreading through school. Can’t protect vulnerable family members. Under5s have 0 protection.
